page_analysis.text_content:
Daylight
plane

The daylight plane in
conjunction with the
setbacks & height
limits, create an
invisible tent

intended to contain
development on the lot
in a way that preserves
privacy and exposure to
natural light.

Code sections
Page 26
18.12.040 (a) Table 2
Page 27
18.04
Page 28
18.12.040 (c) Table 2
Page 29
18.12.050 (b) (2)
18.12.040 (j)

26

Primary daylight plane (sides)

The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area.
Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-
structure daylight plan described on the next page.

Fig 20 Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane

Max. allowed is
Min. required by
Building Code

45°

10' from
average
grade

Side lot line

Average grade

Grade at the nearest point
on the adjacent lot

Existing grade of the structure
(at midpoint of wall)

Notes:
• Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
• Average grade is established using existing
grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)
• Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
• Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

Side lot line

24' max. for protrusions

*
Max. building height

visual_elements.description: An isometric line drawing of a simple house-like structure, representing an 'invisible tent' formed by setbacks and height limits.
visual_elements.location: Middle left, within the 'Daylight plane' section

visual_elements.description: Figure 20: A detailed architectural elevation drawing showing two houses on adjacent lots, illustrating the concept of a 'side primary daylight plane'. The drawing includes ground lines, lot lines, and dashed lines indicating the daylight plane angle and height restrictions. Key measurements and labels are present.
visual_elements.location: Right side, occupying the majority of the page below the main text

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum height from average grade for daylight plane origin

sections: The daylight plane in conjunction with the setbacks & height limits, create an invisible tent (left column text block)
intended to contain development on the lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light. (left column text block)

additional_notes: Page number '26' is located at the bottom left corner.
The asterisk (*) next to 'Max. building height' in the diagram likely indicates a footnote or further explanation, but no corresponding footnote is visible on this page.
The text 'Max. allowed is Min. required by Building Code' is vertically oriented and appears to be a label for a vertical dimension line in the diagram.
